availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

Whereas at the late March Term of the McLean Circuit Court a Judgment for hundred dollars was rendered in favor of this Commonwealth against Robin Stringer and others upon a forfeited Bail Bond executive in the Examining Court by said Robin Stringer and others for the appearance of Bayles Stringer at the September Term of said Circuit Court to answer the charge of drinking
Now we the Undersigned Citizens of McLean County pray that Your Excellency may remit that portiion of said Judgment going to the Commonwealth for the following reasons to wit
(1) The Said Whitaker was in the first instance only slightly injured by the striking charged and has since entirely recevied,
2ndly The party Bayless Stringer was at last Court, ready and willing and anxious to be present and have his trial but was detained by Sickness which confined him to his Room --

Alf. C. Tanner Cllk McLean Cir Cos
D Little Dr Judge for sd County
Wm Calhoun County Att
Wm. H. Overhuls
A J Coffman
W L Bland
J A Miller
J. T. Mason
J. A. Birdwell,
J A Mason
F Karnes
R Shonnbery
M W, Oliver Esq
J J Coffman
John Barett
G W Mullins
H Lyons
A. S. M. Mullins
Besbley
Thomas W,, Henry
John Bruce
B. F. Shutt
H Stringer
J Humphrey
J Donohoo
J Ry Miller
Benjamin Miller
Wm G Nopsinger
Rejected
Tho P Porter
McLean Co
